content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

which prints the poem `The Wasteland` (see below) on screen with a maximum of 10 characters per line.

```julia
function wrap_string()
# Your code here!
end
```

## Example

```julia
wrap_string("The Wasteland") == "The\nWasteland" # true
wrap_string("Hello, Julia", 2) == "He\nll\no,\nJul\nia" # true
wrap_string("Hello World") == "Hello\nWorld" # true
```
